alert.note: Alert for Pima (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 19 at 11:38AM MST until August 19 at 12:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Central Arizona, including the following county, Pima. * WHEN...Until 130 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1135 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated showers and thunderstorms over the Tucson Metro Area have produced between 0.50 and 1.00 inches of rain over the southern portions of the city in the past 30 minutes. Rainfall runoff will drain into normally dry washes, filling them with running water. In addition, significant ponding of water is likely on surface streets in the city of Tucson. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tucson, Davis-Monthan Air Force Base, Drexel Heights, Flowing Wells, Vail, South Tucson, Tucson International Airport, Summit, Catalina Foothills, Saguaro National Park East, Tucson Estates, Rita Ranch and San Xavier Mission. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
